suffdict.name: vFlexRemCerc
suffdict.comment: this is a tense of conocimiento personal; the remoto lejano is non-personal, see HVY:145
there seems to be considerable variation in the forms cited in the grammars--see the notes

entry.comment: Yapita Curso:34 has yäsma too
Briggs:218 has yäsma and :sma, which could be a collapse of the former
Ross indicates lengthening for this suffix, i.e. :yäsma, probably wrong

see HVY:147 about this form, which is kind of borrowed from the Remote Lejano; slightly suspect; see HVY:164 for whole paradigm, including 2-1 istästa and 2-1 ista (see below); both would appear to be borrowings or confusions from other paradigms
HVY:158 has 2-1 chi+yästa , i.e. suggests that the ending for RemCerc 2-1 after chi is just yästa
Yapita Curso:34 also shows just yästa, even w/o chi
see HVY:147 about this form, which appears to be borrowed from the Simple--this is also what we had at ALPS; i.e. this is what Ross shows for 2-1
HVY:156 has 2-1 pacha+RemCerc coming out as pachïsta, with a long vowel, which is suspect
this is the general form in Yapita Curso:34 for 2-1; in HVY:158 it is the form shown after chi, but not mentioned in any paradigm without chi; see HVY:147 and HVY:164
this might appear to be the expected or regular form, but may not actually be used?
lengthens: clear both in Ross and HVY
Yapita Curso:34 agrees
Ross indicates lengthening for this suffix, so :yäta, suspect. Yapita agrees with yäta
Ross indicates lengthening for this suffix, i.e. :yätan, but this is suspect; Yapita Curso:34 agrees with yätan
see HVY:147 for itana (c ?) with short vowel, which appears dead wrong; check it
Ross clearly shows (c c) -itäna and -itänti neg
HVY:158 suggests long ä as above and (c c)
HVY:164 has itana and (c v); very suspect
Yapita Curso:34 has -itäna
see HVY:147 for istana (c ?) which appears wrong; check it
Ross clearly shows (c c) -istäna and -istänti neg
HVY:158 suggests long ä as above and (c c)
HVY:164 has istana and (c v); very suspect
Yapita Curso:34 has -istäna
Ross indicates lengthening for this suffix, i.e. :yäta, but this is unlikely
Yapita Curso:34 agrees with yäta
Ross indicates lengthening for this suffix, i.e. :yätam, which is unlikely
Yapita Curso:34 agrees with yätam
